bioghist.p: Reverend James Joseph Dean (1879-1964) studied at Villanova and went on to do graduate work at University of Pennsylvania. He was ordained to the priesthood on 29 September 1901. For twenty-five years he was a member of the Villanova faculty, teaching mathematics. He served as president of the University from 1917 to 1920. Father Father Dean was an able orator, and during World War I this talent of his was drawn upon for Liberty Loan drives and other patriotic celebrations. In October 1919 Governor Sproul appointed Father Dean a member of the State College and University Council, which passes on charters of incorporation for educational institutions. Father Dean was the first Catholic college president ever appointed to this council.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of papers of Father James Joseph Dean. Materials consist of one folder of correspondence related to academic accreditation, 1918-1919. The letters are notifications of accreditation of programs; one letter indicates that the Engineering School has been accredited by the Secretary of War.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
